snippet: After voters in the district approved legalization last fall, a federal provision seeking to block it may hang on the interpretation of a single word.
abstract: Congressional Republicans have tried to nullify vote legalizing growth and possession of small amounts of marijuana in Washington, DC, via provision in federal spending bill preventing use of tax dollars to enact provision; district officials, however, say they may have found loophole that allows provision to move forward.
lead_paragraph: After voters in the district approved legalization last fall, a federal provision seeking to block it may hang on the interpretation of a single word.

headline.main: District of Columbia Sees Loophole in Congress’s Move to Halt Marijuana Law
headline.print_headline: District of Columbia Sees Loophole in Congress’s Move to Halt Marijuana Law
